result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyvon Deshay Stacy

Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy appeared by video.  
Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Tyvon Deshay Stacy.  
Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense  request a plea and sentencing date. 
Defense advised to file the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in court.  
Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Tyvon Deshay Stacy.  
Attorney Erika Strebel fpr  Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request time to negotiate with the State/
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed: Justice Point Pretrial Services Report.

Received and Filed by Ada Nolten: 
Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence at Trial.

Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense in receipt of lab results and request time to review with client. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn; both appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Sgt. T. Multhauf.   Court took judicial notice of 15cf2444. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Tyvon Deshay Stacy in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyvon Deshay Stacy appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
